newsitem.title: UK: HORSE RACING-CARSON'S LIFE WAS IN DANGER.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-CARSON'S LIFE WAS IN DANGER.

text.p: Jockey Willie Carson's life was in danger after he was kicked by a horse in the paddock at Newbury races eight days ago, his doctor disclosed on Saturday.

Asked if the incident had put Carson's life in danger, consultant Myrddin Rees told BBC radio: "Absolutely. This was a severe injury and if I put it another way, I had a very restless weekend the first weekend he was in."
Rees added: "He remains in remarkably good spirits and over the past week he has shown a resilience and courage, qualities that have made him the champion jockey that he is."
Rees said Carson's injuries, which included a laceration to the liver, would have been more serious had he not been wearing a body protector.
The jockey, who was allowed out of intensive care on Friday, digested his first piece of solid food on Saturday and will stay in hospital for at least another week.

Rees said: "However, the progress we are seeing is quite astounding. I am extremely pleased and I have no doubt that in time he will make a full physical recovery and he can choose whatever he wants to do."
